alert.note: Alert for Emanuel; Johnson; Washington (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Emanuel, south central Washington and Johnson Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 759 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Tuckers Crossroad, or 10 miles west of Wrightsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Wrightsville, Adrian, Harrison, Kite, Spann, Donovan, Blundale, Norristown, Pringle, Norristown Junction, New Home, Meeks, and Scott. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and east central Georgia.
